message.content:
Here's a 7-day healthy meal plan that excludes dairy, garlic, honey, almonds, pistachios, and cashews:

**Monday**

* Breakfast: Oatmeal with fresh berries and walnuts (use sunflower seeds as a substitute for nuts)
	+ 1 cup cooked oatmeal
	+ 1/2 cup mixed berries (such as blueberries, strawberries, raspberries)
	+ 1 tablespoon sunflower seed butter (or another nut-free alternative)
* Lunch: Grilled chicken breast with roasted vegetables and quinoa
	+ 4 oz grilled chicken breast
	+ 1 cup roasted vegetables (such as broccoli, carrots, bell peppers)
	+ 1/2 cup cooked quinoa
* Dinner: Baked salmon with sweet potato and green beans
	+ 6 oz baked salmon
	+ 1 medium sweet potato, baked
	+ 1 cup steamed green beans

**Tuesday**

* Breakfast: Avocado toast on whole grain bread with scrambled eggs
	+ 2 slices whole grain bread
	+ 1/2 avocado, mashed
	+ 2 scrambled eggs
* Lunch: Turkey and avocado wrap with lettuce and tomato
	+ 1 whole wheat tortilla
	+ 2 oz sliced turkey breast
	+ 1/2 avocado, sliced
	+ 1 cup shredded lettuce
	+ 1 medium tomato, sliced
* Dinner: Grilled shrimp with roasted asparagus and brown rice
	+ 4 oz grilled shrimp
	+ 1 cup roasted asparagus
	+ 1/2 cup cooked brown rice

**Wednesday**

* Breakfast: Smoothie bowl with banana, spinach, and sunflower seed butter
	+ 1 medium banana
	+ 2 cups fresh spinach
	+ 1 tablespoon sunflower seed butter (or another nut-free alternative)
	+ 1/2 cup sliced strawberries
* Lunch: Chicken Caesar salad without croutons
	+ 4 oz grilled chicken breast
	+ 2 cups romaine lettuce
	+ 1/2 cup chopped fresh parsley
	+ 1 tablespoon olive oil and lemon juice dressing (make sure it's nut-free)
* Dinner: Beef stir-fry with brown rice and steamed broccoli
	+ 4 oz beef strips (use a nut-free seasonings)
	+ 1 cup cooked brown rice
	+ 1 cup steamed broccoli

**Thursday**

* Breakfast: Whole grain waffles with fresh berries and maple syrup (make sure it's nut-free)
	+ 2 whole grain waffles
	+ 1/2 cup mixed berries
	+ 1 tablespoon maple syrup
* Lunch: Turkey and cheese-free sandwich on whole grain bread with carrot sticks
	+ 2 slices whole grain bread
	+ 2 oz sliced turkey breast
	+ 1 medium apple, sliced
	+ 4 carrot sticks
* Dinner: Grilled chicken breast with roasted Brussels sprouts and quinoa
	+ 4 oz grilled chicken breast
	+ 1 cup roasted Brussels sprouts
	+ 1/2 cup cooked quinoa

**Friday**

* Breakfast: Scrambled eggs with whole grain toast and fresh berries
	+ 2 scrambled eggs
	+ 2 slices whole grain bread
	+ 1/2 cup mixed berries
* Lunch: Grilled chicken wrap with lettuce, tomato, and avocado
	+ 1 whole wheat tortilla
	+ 4 oz grilled chicken breast
	+ 1 cup shredded lettuce
	+ 1 medium tomato, sliced
	+ 1/2 avocado, sliced
* Dinner: Baked cod with roasted sweet potato and green beans
	+ 6 oz baked cod
	+ 1 medium sweet potato, baked
	+ 1 cup steamed green beans

**Saturday**

* Breakfast: Omelette with vegetables (use a nut-free fillings)
	+ 2 eggs
	+ 1/2 cup mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, onions, mushrooms)
* Lunch: Grilled chicken Caesar salad without croutons
	+ 4 oz grilled chicken breast
	+ 2 cups romaine lettuce
	+ 1/2 cup chopped fresh parsley
	+ 1 tablespoon olive oil and lemon juice dressing (make sure it's nut-free)
* Dinner: Beef tacos with roasted vegetables and brown rice
	+ 4 oz beef strips (use a nut-free seasonings)
	+ 1 cup cooked brown rice
	+ 1 cup roasted vegetables (such as zucchini, carrots, bell peppers)

**Sunday**

* Breakfast: Whole grain pancakes with fresh berries and maple syrup (make sure it's nut-free)
	+ 2 whole grain pancakes
	+ 1/2 cup mixed berries
	+ 1 tablespoon maple syrup
* Lunch: Turkey and avocado wrap with lettuce and tomato
	+ 1 whole wheat tortilla
	+ 2 oz sliced turkey breast
	+ 1/2 avocado, sliced
	+ 1 cup shredded lettuce
	+ 1 medium tomato, sliced
* Dinner: Grilled shrimp with roasted asparagus and quinoa
	+ 4 oz grilled shrimp
	+ 1 cup roasted asparagus
	+ 1/2 cup cooked quinoa

Remember to stay hydrated by drinking plenty of water throughout the day. Also, feel free to swap out ingredients or interchange different protein sources if you get bored with the same options. Enjoy your meal plan!
